com.camerontec.catalys.util.thread

Class MonitoredTaskController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.thread.MonitoredTaskController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITask, ITaskController, ITryRunnable, Runnable

    public class MonitoredTaskController
extends Object
implements ITaskController, ITask, ITryRunnable
    A MonitoredTaskController is both a task and a task controller.

    It is capable of controlling a single IControlledTask and in doing so guarantees that the task cannot be run concurrently in separate threads. Naturally this guarantee can be subverted if the task is run manually.

    The ability to cancel() the task is also provided, however, this relies on the co-operation of the task itself via its IControlledTask.interrupt() method.

    By default the thread runs at Thread.NORM_PRIORITY and is not a daemon thread.

    • Method Detail

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Return the controlled task thread's priority.
        Returns:
        The controlled task thread's priority.

      • getIsDaemon

        public boolean getIsDaemon()
        Return whether or not the controlled task's thread is a daemon thread.
        Returns:
        True if the controlled task's thread is a daemon thread, false otherwise.

      • run

        public final void run()
        Run the IControlledTask owned by this operation.

        This method blocks until the monitor can be acquired, then runs the task inside the monitor.

        Note that this method runs before the task is completed. The caller must use the join() method to find out when the task is complete.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • tryRun

        public final boolean tryRun()
        Attempt to run the IControlledTask owned by this operation, but return immediately if the monitor cannot be acquired.

        Note that this method runs before the task is completed. The caller must use the join() method to find out when the task is complete.

        Specified by:
        tryRun in interface ITryRunnable
        Returns:
        True if the task is being run inside the monitor, false if the task did not run.

      • cancel

        public final void cancel()
        Cancel the monitor thread and signal to the running IControlledTask that it should terminate.

        This method does not wait until the thread is dead, use the join(long) method for that.

      • interrupt

        public final void interrupt()
        Interrupt the running task.

      • join

        public final void join()
        Join with the monitor thread, blocking indefinitely.

      • join

        public final boolean join(long timeout)
        Join with the monitor thread.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum join time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        True if the monitor is no longer alive, false otherwise.

      • getExceptions

        public List<Exception> getExceptions()
        Return any exceptions thrown attempting to run the task.

        This method is designed to be called after join() its result is undefined unless this is the case.

        Returns:
        The exception thrown when executing the command, or null if no exception was thrown.

      • addException

        public void addException(Exception e)
        Add an exception to the exception list.

        This method is a hook for the IControlledTask to add any exceptions which occur during execution. Usage of this method after execution may produce undefined results.

        Specified by:
        addException in interface ITaskController
        Parameters:
        e - The exception.

        Description copied from interface: ITaskController

        Specified by:
        shouldContinue in interface ITaskController
        Returns:
        True if the task should continue execution, false if it should terminate.
